meanings.definition: Francizes (verb): grants a license or right to use a brand or business model
meanings.sent1: The company francizes its popular coffee shop concept to entrepreneurs.
meanings.sent2: She decided to francize her successful bakery and expand it to other cities.
meanings.sent3: The magician francizes his unique magic tricks to other performers for a fee.
meanings.sent4: His creativity francizes the art world, bringing new perspectives and ideas.
meanings.sent5: The key to success is to francize your skills and share them with others.

meanings.definition: Francizes (noun): plural form of francize, referring to multiple licenses or rights granted to use a brand or business model
meanings.sent1: The company has many francizes across the country, each running a successful branch.
meanings.sent2: She collected all the francizes she had acquired over the years in a special folder.
meanings.sent3: The room was filled with colorful francizes, each representing a different business opportunity.
meanings.sent4: The francizes lined up on the shelf, showcasing the diversity of brands available.
meanings.sent5: The stack of francizes on the desk symbolized the growth of the company.
